PRISTIN

Introduction

Kyla is a Korean-American rapper, singer, and YouTuber. She was a rapper of the girl group PRISTIN.

In 2017, Pledis announced Kyla as a member of PRISTIN, which debuted on March 21, 2017, with the mini album Hi! and its title track, "Wee Woo".

On October 12, 2017, Pledis announced that Kyla would be halting all group promotions to return to the United States and receive treatment for a concussion.

On May 24, 2019, it was announced by Pledis that PRISTIN was officially disbanding after almost two years without activity. It was also announced that 7 out of 10 members had not renewed their contracts with the agency, Kyla being one of them.

She made her solo American debut on June 13, 2020, with the mini album "Watch Me Glow" in the midst of her online community college in which she majored in psychology. In 2024, she graduated as a biological anthropology major at the University of California San Diego. She plans to pursue medical school. On her TikTok account, she frequently talks about her experience of being an idol.

She is currently in college pursuing a major in Psychology.
